dmca.title: [TP-C465752J] RE: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Monday, August 14, 2006 11:04 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [TP-C465752J] RE: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1 Subject: [TP-C465752J] RE: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1 From: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: [TP-C465752J] RE: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1 Reference: [TP-C465752J] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. RE: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1 Added by system at Monday, Aug 14 2006 03:50 pm X-MailFrom: jsnyder@theesa.com X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.180] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Mon Aug 14 15:49:24 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Mon, 14 Aug 2006 15:49:22 -0500 Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.111]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from jsnyder@theesa.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GCjNC-0006TP-PH for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Mon, 14 Aug 2006 15:49:22 -0500 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Mon, 14 Aug 2006 15:49:22 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from jsnyder@theesa.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GCjNC-0006wj-3a for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 14 Aug 2006 15:49:22 -0500 Received: from dns2-alb.paetec.net ([64.80.0.167]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from jsnyder@theesa.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GCjN0-0006XX-Hl for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 14 Aug 2006 15:49:10 -0500 Received: from hook.theesa.COM (mail.theesa.com [63.138.80.34]) by dns2-alb.paetec.net (8.13.6/8.13.6) with ESMTP id k7EKn4ci017621 for ; Mon, 14 Aug 2006 16:49:09 -0400 (EDT) X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5.7226.0 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6BFE3.145ABDA7" Subject: RE: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1 Date: Mon, 14 Aug 2006 16:49:01 -0400 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1 Thread-Index: Aca/4rqdD0bc0aXMTeegUIqVlyH7jgAADQtg From: "Jake Snyder" To: Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 64.80.0.167 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of theesa.com) client-ip=64.80.0.167; envelope-from=jsnyder@theesa.com; helo=dns2-alb.paetec.net; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 14 Aug 2006 20:49:22.0248 (UTC) FILETIME=[1ED64C80:01C6BFE3] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) To further clarify this notice, the infringing work is the artwork in the Flash banner at the top of the page: http://www.team-vip.com/index.php?openg=21 Regards, Jake Snyder Anti-Piracy Investigator Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 Phone: (202) 223-2400 x134 http://www.theESA.com jsnyder@theESA.com This message and all attachments are meant solely for the intended recipient, and may contain confidential and legally privileged information. If you have received this message in error, any review, use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this message and its attachments is strictly prohibited. Please reply to the sender immediately to advise of the error and delete this message and all copies from your system. ________________________________ From: Jake Snyder Sent: Monday, August 14, 2006 4:47 PM To: 'abuse@theplanet.com' Subject: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1 Importance: High Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 USA Attention: Intellectual Property Enforcement Telephone: 202-223-2400 E-mail: dmcaresponse@theesa.com August 14, 2006 Dear ThePlanet.com, The Entertainment Software Association ("ESA") is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies that publish interactive games for video game consoles, personal computers, handheld devices and the Internet (hereinafter collectively referred to as "ESA members"). ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose copyright and other intellectual property rights it believes to be infringed as described herein. ESA is providing this notice pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act and 17 USC § 512 (c) to make ThePlanet.com aware of material on its network or system that infringes the exclusive copyright and other rights of one or more ESA members. This notice is addressed to you as the agent designated by ThePlanet.com to receive notifications of claimed infringement. ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 70.86.6.50 (www.team-vip.com) infringes the rights of one or more ESA members by offering for sale or download unauthorized copies of game products protected by copyright, or offering for sale or download material that is the subject of infringing activities. The copyrighted works that have been infringed include but are not limited to: World of Warcraft The unauthorized copies of such game product(s) or the material that is the subject of infringing activities appears on or is made available through the above-listed IP address. Those items are listed and/or identified thereon by their titles or variations thereof, game-related listings/references/descriptions, or depictions of game-related artwork. Such copies, titles, game-related listings/references/descriptions, depictions, and material that is the subject of infringing activities are hereinafter referred to as "Infringing Material." Based on the information at its disposal on August 14, 2006, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the copyright owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. Accordingly, ESA hereby requests ThePlanet.com to immediately do the following: 1. Notify the account holder of the Infringing Material. 2. Remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above. 3. Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms of Service Agreement, including termination of a repeat offender. ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate. Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive copyright rights we believe to be infringed as described herein. ThePlanet.com or the account holder may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred. Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence. Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter. Sincerely, Intellectual Property Enforcement Entertainment Software Association MIME element (text/html)

To further clarify this notice, the infringing work is the artwork in the Flash banner at the top of the page:

 

http://www.team-vip.com/index.php?openg=21

 

Regards,

 

Jake Snyder

Anti-Piracy Investigator

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004

Phone: (202) 223-2400 x134

http://www.theESA.com

jsnyder@theESA.com

 

This message and all attachments are meant solely for the intended recipient, and may contain confidential and legally privileged information. If you have received this message in error, any review, use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this message and its attachments is strictly prohibited. Please reply to the sender immediately to advise of the error and delete this message and all copies from your system. 

 

From: Jake Snyder
Sent: Monday, August 14, 2006 4:47 PM
To: 'abuse@theplanet.com'
Subject: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG081406-J1
Importance: High

 

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004 USA

 

Attention:  Intellectual Property Enforcement

Telephone:  202-223-2400

E-mail:  dmcaresponse@theesa.com

 

August 14, 2006

 

Dear ThePlanet.com,

 

The Entertainment Software Association (“ESA”) is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies that publish interactive games for video game consoles, personal computers, handheld devices and the Internet (hereinafter collectively referred to as “ESA members”).  ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose copyright and other intellectual property rights it believes to be infringed as described herein.

 

ESA is providing this notice pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act and 17 USC § 512 (c) to make ThePlanet.com aware of material on its network or system that infringes the exclusive copyright and other rights of one or more ESA members.   This notice is addressed to you as the agent designated by ThePlanet.com to receive notifications of claimed infringement.

 

ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 70.86.6.50 (www.team-vip.com) infringes the rights of one or more ESA members by offering for sale or download unauthorized copies of game products protected by copyright, or offering for sale or download material that is the subject of infringing activities.  The copyrighted works that have been infringed include but are not limited to:

 

World of Warcraft

 

The unauthorized copies of such game product(s) or the material that is the subject of infringing activities appears on or is made available through the above-listed IP address.  Those items are listed and/or identified thereon by their titles or variations thereof, game-related listings/references/descriptions, or depictions of game-related artwork.  Such copies, titles, game-related listings/references/descriptions, depictions, and material that is the subject of infringing activities are hereinafter referred to as "Infringing Material."  

 

Based on the information at its disposal on August 14, 2006, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the copyright owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. 

 

Accordingly, ESA hereby requests ThePlanet.com to immediately do the following:

 

1.   Notify the account holder of the Infringing Material.
2.   Remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above.
3.   Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms

      of Service Agreement, including termination of a repeat offender.

 

ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate.  Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive copyright rights we believe to be infringed as described herein.  ThePlanet.com or the account holder may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred.  Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence.

 

Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter.

 

Sincerely,

 

Intellectual Property Enforcement

Entertainment Software Association

MIME element (text/plain)
